alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 15 at 7:07PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 835 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, Riverside. * WHEN...Until 835 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 707 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated areas of heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen since late afternoon. The rain will become weaker though after 800 PM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moreno Valley, Palm Springs, Idyllwild-Pine Cove, Hwy 243 Between Banning And Idyllwild, Mt San Jacinto State Park, Anza, Hemet, Cathedral City, San Jacinto and Beaumont. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
